name: Elbuntu Pins
author: Ashley Johnson

sections.description:
Elbuntu Pins is a plugin that allows you to display your Pinterest Pins on your website.

Features:

  • Embed your Pinterest Pins with shortcode in a page
  • Automatically syncs with new pins.
  • Choose how many columns you want to display (3, 4 or 5)
  • Configure how links open
  • View as pins or as a gallery

Removing the plugin

  • Deactivate The Plugin
sections.installation:
Requirements:

  • WordPress 2.8 or higher.
  1. Upload elbuntu-pins folder to your WordPress Plugins folder.
  2. Activate the Elbuntu Pins in wp-admin under plugins.
  3. Go to Pins menu item
  4. Configure the plugin
  5. Your all set.

*If upgrading from an older version it is advised that you deactivate the plugin first then reactivate after installation.
sections.faq:
— Other Information —

If you are having difficulties getting this plugin to work please email me with the details
at ashley.gary.johnson@gmail.com.
sections.changelog:
V2.1

  • You can now specify whether or not there should be rounded borders or not.
  • You can now configure whether a link opens in the current/a new tab.
  • You can view the pins as a gallery without the text like a photo albumn.

V2

  • Updated the WordPress code
  • Tested on latest WordPress
  • Can now select how many columns you want (3, 4 or 5)
  • Css now uses percentages instead of fixed widths (for better theme intergration)

0.1

  • Initial Release
